head.title: In Abortion Debate, Clarity Should Rule

hedline.hl1: In Abortion Debate, Clarity Should Rule

block.p: You say (editorial, May 27) that the ''new fuzziness'' in the abortion debate, blurring the meaning of ''pro-choice,'' ''shows how successful pro-life forces have been in limiting abortion rights one restriction at a time.''

You say (editorial, May 27) that the ''new fuzziness'' in the abortion debate, blurring the meaning of ''pro-choice,'' ''shows how successful pro-life forces have been in limiting abortion rights one restriction at a time.''

Between 1974 and 1989, they succeeded in passing restrictions in 34 states, ranging from the parental notification requirements for minors that you note to the withholding of public money for elective abortions. Indeed, recent bans on partial birth abortions are a continuation of this strategy.
The writer is a visiting assistant professor of political science at Yeshiva University.
